item.title: Connectiontypesbuyers: Booking Flow
item.description:
Search, Quote and Book transactions must be executed sequentally in order to book hotel rooms in a Seller. In the following steps you will find the three steps in order to perform the booking flow. You can also consult the Schema through our API playground besides to launch requests. role=“alert”> NOTE: Remember that you can configure which fields you want to receive on the response, you just have to configure them on the correspondent graph query.
[...]

item.title: Connectiontypesbuyers: Reservation Management
Connectiontypesbuyers: Static Content
item.description:
Supplier static information as Hotel-List, Hotel-Room, Hotel-Board, Hotel-Category, Destinations and Metadata are returned through our content calls. We strongly recommend to implement them as sometimes, supplier codes might be different from the ones returned through our API. <a href="/connectiontypesbuyers/hotel-x/methods/staticcontent/hotel/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-h-square"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Hotel</h3> <p>Hotels from a supplier</p> </div> </div> </a> <a href="/connectiontypesbuyers/hotel-x/methods/staticcontent/metadata/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-code"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Metadata</h3> <p>Supplier restriction and configuration</p> </div> </div> </a> <a href="/connectiontypesbuyers/hotel-x/methods/staticcontent/destination/" class="card"> <div class="inner-card"> <div class="material-icons fa fa-street-view"></div> <div> <h3 class="text-headline">Destination</h3> <p>Learn about how to manage static content data in your site: Hotels, Boards, Categories.
[...]
